item.description:
The Massachusetts Chapter of Americans United for Separation of Church and State, a group that many Humanists support, will host a panel of speakers on public school Church/State separation issues. AU President Rev. Barry W. Lynn will keynote the speakers which include Katherine Stewart, Ellery Schempp, and Jessica Ahlquist, on Saturday evening April 13 at 6:30 pm at the Community Church of Boston, 565 Boylston St, Boston 02116 (near Arlington Street).

The topic will be "Separation of Church and State in Our Public Schools." Katherine Stewart is author of "The Good News Club: The Christian Assault on America's Children." Ellery Schempp, President of the Massachusetts Secular Coalition for America and the primary student involved in the landmark 1963 Supreme Court case declaring public-school-sanctioned Bible readings unconstitutional will also speak, as will current Humanist heroine and activist, Cranston RI's young atheist Jessica Ahlquist.

MA AUSCS requests register at http://au-ma.org if you plan to attend or contact chapter president Ron Madnick at rmadnic at msn dot com or by phone at 508-982-1722.
item.name: Americans United Talk: "Separation of Church & State in Our Public Schools"
